description: The /b/pipes/b/ you'll /6/craft/6/ to /6/transport/6/ the many /b/liquids/b/ and /b/gasses/b/ /6/can only contain a single/6/ type of /b/fluid/b/ at a time and they /6/wont/6/ connect directly to /6/empty/6/ /b/pipes/b/ or /b/containers/b/ and /b/machines/b/ automatically, so make sure to use that /b/Wrench/b/ to /6/configure/6/ them properly.

You can /6/forcefully/6/ initiate a connection by /6/right-clicking/6/ the center of the /b/pipe/b/ with your /b/Wrench/b/, or by /6/right-clicking/6/ a /b/block/b/ with a /b/pipe/b/ in /b/your hand/b/; thought it /6/won't consume/6/ the /b/pipe/b/, just connect it.
the /b/Fluid Pipe/b/ will /6/attempt/6/ to evenly /6/extract/6/ from all /b/connected blocks/b/ and then attempt to /6/insert/6/ that into all other /b/connected blocks/b/.

Use them wisely and abuse them to your /6/complete advantage/6/: You can have up to /6/3/6/ /b/pipes/b/ in a/b/ single block/b/ for ultimate compact-ness! Luckily, /b/pipes/b/ of /b/different color/b/ will /6/--never-- connect/6/. Finally, /6/right-clicking/6/ a /b/pipe/b/ with a /b/Wrench/b/ will /6/change/6/ the connection type and /6/shift-right-clicking/6/ will drop the pipe.
